revisions.rev:
Originally a '''stereotype''' was an impression taken from a forme of movable lead type and used for printing instead of the original type. This was generalized into a metaphor for repeating a set of ideas identically with no changes (as would have been possible in a form of movable type).
In modern usage, the metaphorical meaning predominates. The term is generally used to describe a view of a number of persons from the same group as sharing certain characteristic (''stereotypical'') qualities. This usage is sometimes referred to as a [[social stereotype]].
